Pros: Ken is a founder CEO and he’s built a world class company, products are fantastic.
Cons: Going through massive change at the moment and the current US Sales leader is completely unqualified to lead the team. He’s completely vacant from customer meetings, partner meetings, and his all hands calls are uninspiring. People are leaving in droves and the newly rolled out comp plan is accelerating this change. If you are considering a career at Fortinet demand the fine print before you sign.

Pros: Overall well branded with a strong portfolio and Fabric strategy. Trying to pivot to address SASE and SecOps from a reliance on firewalls/network security. People on the sales side that were there the last several years have made some good money
Cons: Lots of internal org changes including some leadership. Weak channel leadership and unnecessary internal channel conflict. Deal protection for partners is <10% , with vague rules of engagement that leave partners with little recourse and low profitability. Little in the way of formal career development or growth opportunities. In fact I didn’t even have a formal annual review in my tenure. Inspection and micromanagement has increased as growth has slowed. Giant marketing teams that hold the purse strings, with questionable measurable impact and understanding of the channel business needs.

Pros:
- hiring team brought on plenty of competent and friendly people
- direct management was extremely supportive and encouraging
- good benefits
- encouraged to network within company if you wanted to move departments and given ample opportunity to hear from people outside of the sales org about their roles
Cons:
- upper management out of touch
- amenities for employees were bare minimum
- unrealistic quotas were assigned every quarter
- training period was short and not thorough enough to cover all aspects of business development, such as channel
- VERY poor handling of wave of layoffs
- HR not helpful at all, HQ building security very condescending and unfriendly
- no provided or subsidized meals for employees

Review Title: No R&D center in reality nothing is being built
Pros: Start up environment. Office location is good
Cons: Nothing is getting developed here. Some testing is going on. I joined with lot of expectations but I don't think I want to do quality checks and testing. Waste of time joining here. People r simply taking high salary but nothing gets built here in reality. Old products decade old are still here while other companies are in cloud and are innovating everyday

Pros:
-politics here are much more straightforward to understand, navigate, and non-malicious than at other organizations
-anyone and everyone encouraged to make their mark in the organization without a lot emphasis on hierarchy
Cons:
-executives are less mature in sophistication and modernized mindset (culture first, people first, etc) 
-too many chefs in the kitchen

Pros: Nice work environment and learning new technology as per defined roles . I like work life culture
Cons: I don’t see any cons except 3 days working from office

Pros:
- Very good Compensation.
- Nice job culture
Cons: Fast changing and challenging work environment.

Review Title: Great Place to work, but not to do a career
Pros:
- Good payment.
- It is great to learn new things and also benefits.
- You receive some stock money (tricky 1 since you are only able to take out the money per year basis, 25% each year) but it is good.
Cons:
- They still use call-center software in where you need to log everything, including breaks, lunch, call wrap-ups, meetings EVERYTHING! What makes you feel you are working in a call center.
- There is not much time (actually 0 time) to invest in yourself to study or do anything besides work.
- Schedule from 12 pm to 9 pm (EST).

Pros: everything is good, can strongly recomend
Cons: don't have anything to comply

Pros: It has been great working for Fortinet during this first year. The best thing is the importance the Fortinet Team gives to the worker family which has an important role in my life. Also, Fortinet has given me the confidence to grow at my pace but encouraged me to try to be as valuable as the rest of the team. Last but not least, the managers (Theo and JC) are amazing and are always concerned about me and how I can perform better.
Cons: I don't have cons after this year.

Pros:
People are willing to help customers and each other
Technical company with good technical people
Cons:
Very poor sales incentive plan. Which makes it hard for sellers to make commission.
Trailing commissions. 
Doesn’t feel like the organisation values sales people. 
Flat management with very little career opportunity

Pros:
- WLB is awesome
- Self-manage most of your work, best thing to happen if you're honest towards work
- Leadership team is good
- Great options to grow in career
- Decent benefits for SEs
Cons:
- Sales Compensation Quota release is a bit too slow every yr.
- Do not expect great yearly bonus

Pros:
-Good team with likeminded folk 
-Room to grow
Cons:
-Fortinet is the kind of company that will bring you from salary to hourly just to save a nickel. 
- ZERO company culture. Holiday party is the only event of the year that appreciates its employees and it is CANCELED 
-Commonly has jobs online, that are roles that have been frozen. 
-If you are employed with Fortinet- it's because they low balled you. If you are a female, you will be underpaid contrary to your male counterparts.
-They would rather hire someone with ZERO experience then pay someone what they are actually worth. 
-Your job is not secure unless you are working as 2-3 people. Many people have been fired.

Review Title: Great company to work for, supportive environment
Pros: Great management and a very supportive team
Cons: Need more work from hone flexibility

Pros: Good work-life balance here in Fortinet
Cons: Appraisals are not so good

Pros: Good insurance, work from home 2 days a week Mon and Friday
Cons: Really poor onboarding/training. The so called managers were all friends of the channel director and looking at their LinkedIn experience non had any managerial experience, nor technical expertise. The pay is a 50/50 structure base pay then commission based on the sales team you support and thats if they reach their sales goals so you won't make nearly what they make you think you you'll get. It is not consistent at all. There is no tuition reimbursement to help further your knowledge in the tech world. They say the others will help train, hahaha, that's if they can find the time. Training is a little batter these days but if your right out of college you'd think a company rhis big would have a robust training department. They don't. Which is amazing considering the industry they are in.

Review Title: Decent colleagues but senior management is apathetic and number crazy
Pros:
Nice office
decent workplace
try to get into sales/account management team instead of business development
Cons: Senior Manager (Director level and above) don't care about employees. NOT GOOD if you are an immigrant and need visa sponsorship. They will make empty promises and keep putting more pressure on you. The Business Development wing does not support career progression opportunities.

Pros: food, travel, good environment to work
Cons: nothing much to say. great to work

Pros: Very good environment in the company
Cons: Office politics which is everywhere

Pros: Good technology, good integration of products
Cons: Management not as good as you would hope

Review Title: Pretty good.  Not perfect, of course.
Pros: Most employees are really great people.
Cons: Too much busy work most of the time. Some outdated systems can be frustrating.

Pros: Good sharp technical people and immediate management layer.
Cons: Terrible Executive Management who are not willing to invest in a vertical they know will take 12 to 18 months to win business. Expecting monthly revenue in a vertical that buys on bi-yearly or yearly budget cycles. Found out they have tried with 5 other Sakes Guys and continually “churn” year on year without adjusting the approach. Sales Teams are treated terribly. Technical teams are cherished. If you interview ask them the average length of their Sales Teams in a vertical vs. Technical Teams = if you don’t see a trend you are wearing a blindfold!

Pros:
It's a job
salary is always on time
30 days vacation
Cons:
Very toxic management. It feels like totalitarian regime
People are not allowed to express their opinion or to bring up flaws. If they do, they are being silenced and marked as "negative". 
The managers keep introducing extremely annoying rules and changes, which almost never work. Bring additional pointless tasks all the time.
Sometimes they will introduce changes that seems only there to justify the existence of someone otherwise completely useless.

Company cost cutting a lot, removing bonuses, cutting everything they possibly can lately.

Lower tier managers are just pupets, they are afraid to question any decision or rules coming to them nor bring any flaws higher and try to hide any problems. There is no point to share anything to them as it just goes to a black hole.

The whole work organization is a complete chaos, no proper tiers, everyone doing everything. Senior employees annoyed by noob tasks, junior ones stuck with advanced tasks. 

80% of the job is a call center, answer random phone calls many times from annoying people asking you to "do the needful". Sure at the same time you have to do something more advanced and constantly be interrupted by those calls.

Progress is completely 0. If you want a promotion, make sure to become a puppet to the proper manager. Don't dare to question anything he says, especially on a team meeting.
Although it is questionable how much a "promotion" is worth it, since there are many cases where employees reject promotions because they are traps. 

Management name and introduce positions with fancy names like "cybersecurity engineer" just to be attractive but then you actually do call center work.

I am probably missing something, but the review will become way too long if I will be listing everything. Just stay away from this place unless you are desperate for some job, and especially if you are really skilled IT person.

Pros: Hybrid work, make your own schedule, no micromanagement, educational opportunities, access to high level sales management
Cons: Communication, promotional opportunity, varying job role expectations, unpredictable at times

Pros:
Fair 
salary, and offer stock
Cons: Lack experience leaders especially in the sales/bdr team

Pros: Some great products. Great vision. Get to work with cutting edge technology sometimes. You can move around in the company but promote from within is declining. Unlimited PTO with your mangers approval is nice. Lots of product training.
Cons: Depending on who your manager is will drastically influence your experience. Culture is declining and getting more severe. Focus on bottom line is being pushed harder and ruthless layoffs when profit isn't what the street expects makes people nervous. Unrealistic quotas (but that isn't really new). Mangement of quota payouts is *really* poor. The good, helpful, everybody wins culture is fading as external hires dilute it (more promotion from within would help keep it). Lots of managers dont know what they are doing because they are new. Trying to get help from experts on products has become nearly impossible and it was designed to be that way.

Review Title: Don't believe the hype (is a sequel)
Pros: Half decent pay but good medical benefits.
Cons: While the company may have been touted as a top workplace, the reality doesn't match the hype. The atmosphere is toxic which leaves employees feeling constantly on edge. There's a lack of adequate training, leaving individuals to navigate their roles independently. Additionally, when profits dip, management may resort to questionable tactics to terminate or lay off employees solely to boost their bottom line.

Pros: Great working environment, nice coworkers.

Review Title: Think twice before joining Portugal TAC
Pros:
Is a good place to learn, every day you will have a new challenge
My colleagues were amazing
If you want to get Fortinet certificates, you will have access to vouchers
Cons:
- no career plan, if you try to apply for other internal positions you will never be successful, I heard from my manager that they prefer to hire someone from outside that allows you to move.
-a really stressful job, you are like a fireman putting out the fire, people only call to ask for help, and most of the time you will not have time to test, analyze, or to do real troubleshooting, because every problem is the most important one.
-Some customers are rude and will threaten you poorly
-Some customers don't have any IT background, are you will be talking with doors
-The Portuguese TAC is like an island, isolated from the rest of the company, you will only meet other people at the Christmas dinner, and you will never be invited to any event in the company, to tech event outside, nothing
-You will never get any training from other vendors, cloud, etc
-Dont believe in company promises

Pros: Lots of opportunities to learn
Cons:
Heavy work schedules.
Hard to grow.

Cons: no career path or promotion but stable

Minimal training and mentoring for new employees, you have to find your way and if you struggle that means you are stupid&weak.
Also, the job is more like a call-center, you answer calls all day everyday, very little time to focus on one issue and learn something from that experience.
No benefits added to salary.

Review Title: My 5th The main challenge company poses to you is your ability to reinvent yourself all the time.  on the company
Pros: I’m celebrating 5 years in the company and I would like to share it has been such an amazing ride. From a team of 20 to more than 50 people, I had the opportunity to grow alongside with the team, learning from them and from the experiences along the way, sometimes making mistakes, but always trying to do my best on a company that listens to you, takes you into consideration, and allows you to propose or implement new ways to achieve the objectives we pursue. I hope to continue learning from Fortinet and my team for many more years, accompanying both on their next stages of growth to come !
Cons: The main challenge company will pose to you, is your ability to reinvent yourself all the time.

Pros: Fortinet was a decent place to work. It provided stable employment with good benefits and decent pay.
Cons: There was a lot of disconnect between upper management and the employees on my team. We never really had a good idea of where the company was taking our team. Also, when we were hired we were told we would get a bonus up to X amount, but when we received significantly less than X, we were never told why.

Review Title: Please consider working here, their culture is not the best
Pros: Good benefits: health insurance, dental insurance and additional annual bonus.
Cons: The company culture can be demanding, and it can be difficult to maintain a healthy work-life balance. The company's leadership structure could be more transparent, and communication between management and employees could be improved, decision-making processes at times feel unclear!. While the company offers stability and routine, there could be more opportunities for career development and internal promotion. There seems to be a focus on results rather than employee well-being. It would be beneficial to see more recognition and appreciation for individual contributions.
